Health & Safety for Licensed Child Care Providers, Module C
Section 3: Emergency Preparedness, Response, & Recovery 

Participation Activity: True or False

Display Answers
X
Question Answer
Children can display physical illness, post traumatic stress symptoms, lower school attendance, and trouble learning as a result of experiencing a natural disaster. TRUE
Power outages, gas leaks, and dam failures are examples of Man-Made Emergency Hazards. FALSE - Power outages, gas leaks, and dam failures are examples of Technological Emergency Hazards.
The three phases of Emergency Management are Retribution, Response, and Recovery. FALSE - The three phases of Emergency Management are Preparedness, Response and Recovery.
The Save the Children Emergency training, the Early Childhood Learning & Knowledge Center Emergency Preparedness Manual, and LARA are all excellent resources for assistance in developing an Emergency Plan. TRUE
